description: MS-DOS 2.0 to 3.2x created backup disks that contained a copy of each backed-up file and a BACKUPID.@@@ file. The file identified the disk as an MS-DOS backup disk.

FreeDOS, an open-source operating system that emulates MS-DOS on modern PCs and mobile devices, can also create backups that contain BACKUPID.@@@ files. To do so, use the FreeDOS /v (version) switch to choose the 3.2x and earlier backup format.

common_filenames.description: BACKUPID.@@@ - a file created by MS-DOS or FreeDOS that identifies a disk as a backup disk
